alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Mercer, southern Whiteside, Rock Island, northwestern Bureau, Henry and southeastern Scott Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 559 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Princeton to Aledo. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bettendorf, East Moline, Le Claire, Hampton and Princeton around 605 PM CDT. Port Byron, Rapids City and Cordova around 610 PM CDT. Boden around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cable, North Henderson, New Windsor, Erie, New Windsor, Alpha, Prophetstown and Woodhull. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 297 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 280 between mile markers 10 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
